claim: One type of COVID-19 test identifies coronavirus proteins in thirty minutes
label: support

claim: Bats' biological ability to detect cytosolic DNA in the body helps them respond to and fight against viruses
label: refute

claim: A research team found 69 drugs that target the same proteins in our cells the novel coronavirus does
label: support

claim: Mask-wearers with clinical respiratory illness are less likely to infect others in their households who are not wearing masks
label: support

claim: COVID-19 has been linked with cases of a similar rare condition in children called Kawasaki disease
label: support

claim: High rates of anxiety, depression, and insomnia were found among medical workers who treated COVID-19 patients
label: support

claim: Men often have higher levels of antibodies than women once exposed to COVID-19
label: refute

claim: High levels of a cytokine called interleukin-6 (IL-6) are associated with respiratory failure and death in COVID-19 patients
label: support

claim: Drugs that block interleukin-6 activity can decrease likelihood of death among mechanically ventilated COVID-19 patients
label: support

claim: Pro-vaccine Facebook clusters are smaller in size than anti-vaccine clusters
label: refute

claim: Children tend to be less susceptible to infection from COVID-19 than adults are
label: support

claim: Traditional, manual contact tracing is too slow to keep pace with the spread of the novel coronavirus
label: support

claim: Blood pressure drugs increase severity of COVID-19 cases
label: refute

claim: COVID-19 testing that can simultaneously screen patients for the novel coronavirus and its antibodies worsens diagnostic sensitivity
label: refute

claim: Individuals with COVID-19 can transmit the virus by speaking normally in an enclosed space
label: support

claim: Computer modeling supports evidence implicating small, airborne droplets in multiple outbreaks of COVID-19
label: support

claim: Wearing a face mask does not reduce the likelihood that someone with coronavirus spreads it to another person
label: refute

claim: Sunlight could help to reduce the amount of the novel coronavirus lingering on surfaces
label: support

claim: Synthetic interferons, a treatment option for a number of immune disorders, are inapplicable to the treatment of COVID-19
label: refute

claim: Ferrets pass the novel coronavirus on to one another in a different way than humans do
label: refute

claim: The coronavirus can spread through the air in enclosed spaces
label: support

claim: The transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is not related to the airflow direction within an indoor space
label: refute

claim: Singing may result in increased transmission of COVID-19 due to the increased emission of aerosolized virus
label: support

claim: COVID-19 patients typically are at high risk for delirium
label: support

claim: Men have been less likely than women to engage in coronavirus protective health behaviors
label: support

claim: Homemade cloth masks are less effective than proper surgical ones in blocking bacterial and viral aerosols
label: support

claim: Genetically, SARS-CoV-2 is dissimilar to coronaviruses found in pangolins
label: refute

claim: Genetic sequencing indicates that the virus that causes COVID-19 is likely to have originated in bats
label: support

claim: Social distancing of at least 1 meter reduces COVID-19 transmission
label: support

claim: COVID-19-positive patients who do not show symptoms are not contagious
label: refute

claim: People can spread the coronavirus before they started coughing and feeling achy
label: support

claim: The novel coronavirus uses a different entry point into human cells as SARS does
label: refute

claim: There is a greater risk of catching COVID-19 indoors than there is risk of catching it outdoors
label: support

claim: A small fraction of people who contract COVID-19 appear to be responsible for a disproportionately large number of subsequent infections
label: support

claim: Convalescent plasma therapy does not improve clinical results in patients suffering from COVID-19
label: support

claim: The coronavirus can result in severe long-term neurological effects
label: support

claim: There are approximately 1 in 4 incidences of venous thromboembolism in patients with severe novel coronavirus pneumonia symptoms of SARS-CoV-2
label: support

claim: Most children who contract COVID-19 display only mild symptoms while ill
label: support

claim: Some babies born to pregnant women with COVID-19 may contract the disease in the womb
label: support

claim: Individuals with blood type A are more susceptible to COVID-19 infection, compared with the other blood groups
label: support

claim: The majority of coronaviruses have a winter seasonality
label: support

claim: The coronavirus can be detected in the air up to 13 feet away from an infected patient
label: support

claim: Close monitoring of the reproduction number of COVID-19 is crucial to preventing a second wave of infections
label: support

claim: SARS-CoV-2 cellular immunity was not found in the blood of COVID-19 patients once they became virus-free
label: refute

claim: Convalescent plasma given to severe COVID-19 patients worsened their symptoms
label: refute

claim: Hydroxychloroquine is consistently effective in improving the prognosis of patients hospitalized with COVID-19
label: refute

claim: Horseshoe bats are the reservoir species for many SARS-like coronaviruses
label: support

claim: Flight, which is shared by all bats but no other mammals, has allowed bats to evolve mechanisms that protect them from viruses
label: support

claim: Research suggests that children are not likely to die from the coronavirus or to suffer a severe health consequence
label: support

claim: Hydroxychloroquine had no impact on the coronavirus recovery time of patients who were mildly ill
label: refute

claim: COVID-19 is equally transmissible via indoor and outdoor environments
label: refute

claim: Men of color face higher risk of contracting COVID-19
label: support

claim: Even a year later there exists protection acquired with the immune response to a patient's first infection of COVID-19
label: support

claim: A team of researchers at New York University's Langone Medical Center found that, out of 84 patients treated with the combination of hydroxychloroquine and azithromycin, 11 percent had QT prolongation beyond 500 milliseconds - the proven danger zone for sudden cardiac death
label: support

claim: Stealth transmissions play only a minor role in COVID-19's spread
label: refute

claim: Only a third of hospitalized COVID-19 patients had a fever
label: support

claim: There is no correlation between smoking and illness progression of covid-19
label: refute

claim: The majority of people with confirmed coronavirus were likely infected by people who didn't know they had it
label: support

claim: Cansino reported that their Phase 2 trials demonstrated that their adenovirus vectored coronavirus vaccine produced no detectable immune response
label: refute

claim: Superspreading events can happen at call centers
label: support

claim: Disease-fighting antibodies, as well as immune cells called B cells and T cells that are capable of recognizing the virus, do not persist after the infections have resolved
label: refute

claim: The infectiousness of SARS-CoV-2 appears to peak within the first few days of the onset of COVID-19 symptoms and then decrease with time
label: support

claim: Researchers also found that people with Type O blood were slightly less likely to get COVID-19 than people with other blood types
label: support

claim: Black and Hispanic Americans are more likely to be affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, compared with white people
label: support

label: support

claim: Infected individuals who don't feel ill may carry just as much coronavirus in their nose, throat and lungs as those with symptoms
label: support

claim: People with obesity who caught the coronavirus were more than twice as likely to end up in the hospital
label: support

claim: Some patients hospitalized with COVID-19 had new-onset psychosis
label: support

claim: A study of more than 130,000 people found that autoimmune conditions like Type 1 diabetes, psoriasis and rheumatoid arthritis increase the risk of respiratory complications and death from COVID-19
label: support

claim: Changes in coronavirus levels in wastewater preceded rises and falls in positive test results by a few days
label: support

claim: Cats can be infected by the novel coronavirus but are unlikely to get sick
label: support

claim: An estimated 40 percent of people with COVID-19 infections never develop symptoms like fevers
label: support

claim: Heart muscle cell damage is not an associated condition among hospitalized COVID-19 patients
label: refute

claim: PCR tests can reliably detect, in just a few hours, as few as 100 copies of viral RNA in a milliliter of spit or snot

claim: Germicidal UV can effectively inactivate airborne microbes that transmit SARS-CoV
label: support

claim: Mothers infected with COVID-19 are likely to pass the infection to their newborns regardless of health precautions taken
label: refute

claim: Global wildlife trade, particularly in exotic or endangered species has no impact on the risk of transmission of the coronavirus
label: refute

claim: Adults who tested positive for the coronavirus were just as likely to have eaten at a restaurant in the two weeks before getting sick compared with people who were not infected
label: refute

claim: A stretch of DNA that decreases the risk of severe illness from COVID-19 was passed down from Neanderthals 60,000 years ago
label: refute

claim: COVID-19 does not have a humidity or temperature dependent niche
label: refute

claim: Among women of reproductive age with COVID-19, nonpregnant women are more likely to be hospitalized in the ICU than pregnant women are
label: refute

claim: Research from Chinese scientists indicates that it is unlikely that the virus causing COVID-19 was transmitted directly from pangolins to humans
label: support

claim: Individuals with mild symptoms of coronavirus can spread SARS-CoV-2 through the air
label: support

claim: COVID-19's secondary attack rate has been found to be between about 10 to 20 percent
label: support

label: support

claim: Pregnant women with coronavirus are at an increased risk of severe illness
label: refute

claim: Recent scientific studies find no evidence of localized genetic susceptibility to respiratory failure in COVID-19 patients
label: refute

label: refute

claim: Clofazimine fought off the SARS-CoV-2 in animals if they received it soon after being infected
label: support

claim: There is not a supported link between Vitamin D concentration and the risk of COVID-19 infection
label: support
